Subject: [junit] how to setup tests in a server environment?

I would like to use JUnit to run tests in our current dev environement but I'm not sure how to proceed. We use WebLogic as our web/JSP server. On this server we are running a set of WebLogic services that retrieve data from our databases. I want to test the objects that interact with those services. This means I have to have create the objects within the WebLogic context (as servlets or in JSP files).

Is there a way to take advantage of JUnit's testing framework (including the assertions, logging of problems and the display of results) from within a servlet? Has anyone written a TestCase/TestSuite servlet?

Andy Kriger
